EN: You're right... Apart from writing poems, I'm not good at anything else...

CN: 西岱是花与诗的城市，是我们的故乡……可这里的玫瑰都死掉了，柯蕾特……
EN: Cité, the city of flowers and poems, is our home... But all the roses have withered here, Colette...

CN: 这些玫瑰，是你曾经送我的。今天，我把它们还给你。
EN: These roses are the ones you once gave me. Today, I am returning them to you.

CN: 她上前一步。
EN: She takes a step forward.
Poof—

CN: 奥尔拉！！！
EN: Horla!!!

CN: 尖利的荆棘撕破她的衣服，刺入她的皮肉，她丝毫不在意。
EN: Sharp thorns tear her clothes and pierce her flesh, but she doesn't care.

CN: 巨大的玫瑰尖刺贯穿了她的心脏。她的鲜血顺着黑色的藤蔓流下。流过了第一个枝头。
EN: A massive rose spike pierced her heart. Her blood flowed down the black vine, passing the first branch.

CN: 黑色的花朵迅速在枝头凋亡。一朵红色的玫瑰，从枝头探出花苞，舒展，盛开。
EN: The black flowers wither rapidly on the branches. A red rose bud appears, unfurls, and blooms.

CN: 鲜血顺着藤蔓，如同树叶的脉络一样，流向了城市的各个角落。
EN: Blood flows along the vines, like the veins of leaves, spreading to every corner of the city.

CN: 它所经过的地方，晦暗的黑色消失。它将色彩与情感、将花与诗还给了西岱。
EN: Where it passed, the deep darkness faded. It restored color and emotion, flowers and poetry to Cité.

CN: 好……好痛……
EN: So... much pain...

CN: 心脏……好像被刺穿了……
EN: Heart... feels as if it's been pierced...

CN: 那是……母亲！母亲……
EN: That's... Mother! Mother...

CN: 孩子……我的孩子出生了……
EN: Child... my child has been born...

CN: 随着鲜血的蔓延，一幅幅图景在人们的眼前浮现。
EN: As the blood spreads, scenes unfold before people's eyes.

CN: 那是婴孩的新生，是母亲的歌谣，是恋人的诀别。
EN: It is the newborn's rebirth, the mother's lullaby, and the lovers' farewell.

CN: 那是你们人生中最为珍贵的时刻。
EN: That was the most precious moment in your lives.

CN: 奥尔拉所经历的巨大的痛苦，随着她的鲜血，涟漪般传向了整个西岱。
EN: The immense pain that Horla endured spread throughout all of Cité, rippling with her blood.

CN: 玫瑰的尖刺贯穿了无数颗心脏。鲜红的花朵，在每个人心中盛开。
EN: Rose spikes pierce countless hearts. Crimson flowers blossom within every one.

CN: 柯蕾特，你已经有了整个西岱，可你还住在这里。
EN: Colette, you own all of Cité, yet you still live here.

CN: 住在我们曾经梦想住着的房子，住在我们曾经一起生活的花园……
EN: Living in the house we once dreamed of, in the garden where we once lived together...

CN: 你曾经救下过我的命。这首用生命写的诗，送给你，送给花园。
EN: You once saved my life. This poem, written with life, is for you and for the garden.

CN: 这是春天，写给花园的诗。
EN: This is a poem written for the garden in spring.

CN: 奥尔拉……你……
EN: Horla... you...

CN: 泪水冲刷着她精致的妆容，她毫不在意，任由它们在脸上留下不得体的凌乱痕迹。
EN: Tears washed away her delicate makeup, but she didn't care, letting them leave messy traces on her face.

CN: 柯蕾特忘记了，自己的泪水是从什么时候开始流下的。
EN: Colette couldn't remember when her tears had started to flow.

CN: ——过往的画面在她眼前清晰地展开。这是她第一次，真正读懂了奥尔拉的诗。她终于明白了自己真正珍视的东西。
EN: —Past scenes unfold clearly before her. For the first time, she truly understood Horla's poetry. She finally realized what she truly cherished.

CN: 不只是她。这个西岱中的所有人，都读懂了奥尔拉的诗。他们被奥尔拉的情绪所触动，动弹不得。
EN: Not just her. Everyone in the Cité understood Horla's poem. They were moved by Horla's emotions and could not move.

CN: 就是现在！
EN: It's now!

CN: 你早有准备，强大的精神力让你从奥尔拉的情绪中挣脱出来。
EN: You were well-prepared, your powerful spirit power allowing you to break free from Horla's emotions.

CN: 你摆脱荆棘的束缚，夺下了柯蕾特手里的诗集。
EN: You break free from the thorns and snatch the poem collection from Colette's hand.

CN: 永别了……诗里的西岱！
EN: Farewell... Cité in the poems!

CN: 银光猛然闪烁。强烈的光芒下，诗集上的融蚀痕迹快速地蒸发、消融。
EN: A flash of silver. Under intense light, the D-mark on the poem evaporates and dissolves rapidly.
Ugh! —

CN: 强烈的刺痛袭向你。大量的精神力损耗让你不堪重负。
EN: A sharp pain strikes you. The heavy loss of spirit power overwhelms you.

CN: 那本被清除掉融蚀的诗集变成了一堆普通的发黄旧稿，被简易别针别在一起，掉落在地。
EN: That poetry collection, purged of Dissolution, turned into a pile of yellowed old drafts, simply clipped together with a basic clip, and fell to the ground.
Ah! Ah!!—

CN: 无数的怪物们吼叫着，倒在地上，逐渐恢复成人的形态。
EN: Countless monsters roar, fall to the ground, and gradually revert to human form.

CN: 权欲在消退，情感在回归。构建这个世界的根基荡然无存。
EN: Desire fades, emotions return. The foundation of this world crumbles.

CN: 柯蕾特感受到了。
EN: Colette felt it.

CN: 她感受到了力量的消失。她感受到了失败的到来。她唤出利刃般的棘刺，走向奥尔拉。
EN: She felt her power fading. She felt defeat approaching. She summoned thorn-like blades and walked towards Horla.

CN: “柯蕾特”，胜利……老夫人的狗死了，她把那条狗的名字赏给我的时候，你就在我旁边。
EN: "Colette," victory... When the old lady's dog passed away and she gave me its name, you were right beside me.

CN: 这是狗的名字，但我从来没有换过。我要提醒自己，不能再输了。
EN: This is the dog's name, but I've never changed it. I need to remind myself not to lose again.

CN: 你说的对。我忘不掉你，忘不掉这里的一切……
EN: You're right. I can't forget you, can't forget everything here...

CN: 我想赢。我只是想赢。想赢有什么错？
EN: I want to win. I just want to win. What's wrong with wanting to win?

CN: 抱歉，奥尔拉。
EN: Sorry, Horla.

CN: 柯蕾特痛苦地抽泣着，缓缓向奥尔拉靠近。
EN: Colette sobbed in anguish, slowly approaching Horla.

CN: 密境在消失，你的计划已经失败了，柯蕾特！
EN: The Domain is vanishing. Your plan has failed, Colette!

CN: 就算你现在对她动手，也改变不了什么！
EN: Even if you attack her now, it won't change a thing!

CN: 你挣扎着，想要靠近奥尔拉，但强烈的痛苦让你无法移动。
EN: Struggling to approach Horla, the intense pain immobilized you.

CN: 尖刺伸向奥尔拉的头颅。
EN: The spike extends towards Horla's head.

CN: 等等！！
EN: Wait!!

CN: 咔嚓——
EN: *Snap*—

CN: 一朵玫瑰被剪下。柯蕾特拿着它，递到了奥尔拉面前。
EN: A rose was cut. Colette took it and handed it to Horla.

CN: 一首好诗，奥尔拉……我就用我的花，来换你的诗吧。
EN: A fine poem, Horla... I'll trade my flowers for your poem.
Bang—

CN: 或许是密境的消解让花匠变化。
EN: Perhaps the Domain's dissolution changed the gardener.

CN: 又或许是花匠的变化让密境消解。
EN: Or perhaps the gardener's transformation caused the Domain to dissolve.

CN: 诗集中的西岱渐渐消失，支撑柯蕾特的力量也不复存在。
EN: The Cité in the poems is gradually disappearing, and the power supporting Colette has also vanished.

CN: 她的身体变成了一滩黑泥，混合着零落的花瓣，沉入奥尔拉身前的土地里。
EN: Her body turned into a pool of black sludge, mixed with scattered petals, sinking into the ground in front of Horla.

CN: 柯蕾特柯蕾特，看完了吗？
EN: Colette, Colette, are you finished reading?

CN: 嗯……看完了……不过我好像看不太懂。
EN: Hmm... I've finished reading... but I don't quite understand it.

CN: 啊，这样吗……这是我写的第一首诗，写得不好……
EN: Ah, is that so...? This is my first poem. It's not very good...

CN: 不是你的问题，奥尔拉，谁的诗我都看不懂。
EN: It's not you, Horla. I don't really understand anyone's poetry.

CN: 我问了身边好多人，他们也看不懂。
EN: I asked many people around me, and they couldn't make sense of it either.

CN: 我不太明白，一个人们都看不懂的东西，到底有什么意义呢……
EN: I don't get it... What's the point of something that no one can comprehend?

CN: 嗯……我觉得，诗歌并不是一种文字或者画面，它像是一把钥匙。
EN: Hmm... I think poetry isn't just words or images; it's like a key.

CN: 钥匙？
EN: A... key?

CN: 对！人的心都像是一个箱子，里面装着好多好多的感情。这个箱子被上了锁，这些感情平时都被锁在箱子里，想拿也拿不出来。
EN: Yes! A person's heart is like a box filled with many emotions. This box is locked, and these emotions are usually kept inside, hard to take out.

CN: 诗呢，就是打开这个箱子的那把钥匙。
EN: Poetry is the key to unlocking this chest.

CN: 其实，诗是不需要被读懂的，甚至连被阅读都不需要。
EN: Actually, poetry doesn't need to be understood, or even read.

CN: 每个人，不论读不读诗，不论早还是晚，在他们生命的某个瞬间，都一定会找到这把钥匙的。
EN: Everyone, whether they read poetry or not, sooner or later, will find this key at some moment in their life.

CN: 那你肯定会成为最好的钥匙匠！
EN: You'll surely become the best keysmith!

CN: 骗人……你刚刚才说了没看懂。
EN: Liar... You just said you didn't get it.

CN: 你说的这些我都听不懂。可是我相信你，奥尔拉。
EN: I don't understand what you're saying, but I trust you, Horla.

CN: 这首《玫瑰的栖居》，是你写的第一首诗。从今天开始，你所有的诗我都会帮你珍藏起来的。
EN: This poem, "The Abode of Roses," is your first piece. From today onward, I will help you treasure all your poems.

CN: 我会用别针把它们整理到一起，等以后有钱了，就把它们印成一本漂亮的诗集！
EN: I'll use pins to keep them together, and when I have money, I'll print a beautiful poetry collection!

CN: 她伸出一直背在身后的手。那双手布满了棘刺留下的伤口，黝黑，粗糙，完全辨认不出是一双属于少女的手。
EN: She extended her hand, which she had kept behind her back. The hands were covered in wounds from thorns, dark and rough, completely unrecognizable as those of a young girl.

CN: 这……这个是……
EN: This... this is...

CN: 听那些新贵族们说，西岱是花与诗的城市，一首好诗，可以换到一束玫瑰……
EN: The new nobles say that Cité is a city of flowers and poetry. A good poem can earn you a bouquet of roses...

CN: 我种的玫瑰今天开了。开的不是很多，全部都拿去付了房租和地租。
EN: My roses bloomed today. Not many, and all were used to pay the rent and land lease.

CN: 不过我趁他们不注意，悄悄留下了一朵……
EN: But while they weren't paying attention, I secretly kept a flower...

CN: 那只满是伤痕的手，将一朵有些残破、但依然鲜红的玫瑰，递到了奥尔拉的面前。
EN: That scarred hand presented a slightly damaged yet still vividly red rose to Horla.

CN: 一首好诗，奥尔拉……以后，我就用我的花，来换你的诗吧！
EN: A fine poem, Horla... In the future, I'll trade my flowers for your poems!

CN: 余香
EN: Lingering Fragrance

CN: 宁菲亚小姐宁菲亚小姐！
EN: Miss Nymphaea! Miss Nymphaea!

CN: 啊，汉娜小姐，你又来找我了……
EN: Ah, Miss Hannah, you've come to see me again...

CN: 我也很高兴见到你！
EN: Well I'm glad to see you too!

CN: 那个，有个急事要问你……
EN: Um, I have an urgent matter to ask you about...

CN: 我不知道奥尔拉在哪。
EN: I don't know where Horla is.

CN: 啊？！怎么可能！她都已经回来一天了，都还没联系你吗！
EN: What?! How is that possible! She's been back for a whole day and still hasn't contacted you?!

CN: 难道外界关于你们两个关系不好的传闻是真的？
EN: Could the rumors about the two of you not getting along be true?

CN: 是因为文学爱好者之间的互相轻贱吗？还是因为成为了情敌？！
EN: Is it due to mutual disdain among literature enthusiasts? Or have you turned into romantic rivals?!

CN: ……我还有点事，请允许我先告辞……
EN: ...I have some matters to attend to, please excuse me...

CN: 喂喂喂！宁菲亚小姐！
EN: Hey hey hey! Miss Nymphaea!

CN: 汉娜。
EN: Hannah.

CN: 请稍等守密人！我有急事要找宁菲亚小姐！弄不好这就是头条新闻！
EN: Wait a moment, Keeper! I urgently need to see Miss Nymphaea! This could very well be headline news!

CN: 奥尔拉让我来找你。
EN: Horla sent me to find you.
Huh?!!!

CN: 汉娜紧急刹住了脚。
EN: Hannah came to a sudden stop.

CN: 她让我把这个交给你。
EN: She asked me to give this to you.

CN: 《玫瑰的栖居》，奥尔拉·柯蕾特……
EN: The Abode of Roses, by Horla Colette...

CN: 这是！！奥尔拉的诗集？！！！还有奥尔拉的新笔名？！
EN: Is this... Horla's poem?! And a new pen name, too?!

CN: 她让我转达，如果你觉得不错的话，请你帮她发表在……
EN: She asked me to pass on the message that, if you think it's good, to please help her publish it in—

CN: 没问题没问题！诗好不好不重要，有话题度就够了！
EN: No problem, no problem! It doesn't matter if the poem is good or not, as long as it generates some buzz!

CN: 另外守密人，奥尔拉愿意接受我的专访吗？！
EN: Also, Keeper, is Horla willing to accept my exclusive interview?!

CN: 你就悄悄带我过去见一见……
EN: Just quietly take me to see her, and...

CN: 再贪心的话，小心连诗集都没的发表了。
EN: Be too greedy, and you might not even get that poem published.
Oh...

CN: 诗集交给汉娜了。
EN: I gave the poem to Hannah.

CN: 您之前和我说，诗集带来的并不是不幸，我怎么都不相信。
EN: You once told me that the poems didn't bring misfortune, but I couldn't believe it.

CN: 这次以后，我才真正明白过来。
EN: Only after this did I truly come to understand.

CN: 谢谢您，守密人%sirormadam%！
EN: Thank you, {Male=Sir,Female=Madam} Keeper!

CN: 这些话你可以留着等汉娜给你做专访的时候说……
EN: You can save these words for when Hannah interviews you...

CN: 啊……不要不要……我还是不太敢和别人说话……不过我会慢慢调整的！
EN: Ah... no, no... I still don't dare to talk to others... but I'll adjust gradually!

CN: 开个玩笑。我已经帮你回绝她了。
EN: Just kidding. I've already declined her on your behalf.

CN: 奥尔拉长舒一口气。你走到她身旁。
EN: Horla lets out a deep sigh. You approach her.

CN: 你知道，汉娜就算把诗集发表出来，也没多少人真正会在意的。
EN: You know, even if Hannah publishes that poem, few people would actually care.

CN: 大家在意的，其实也只是围绕那本诗集的故事和话题。
EN: What people really care about is the stories and topics surrounding that collection of poems.

CN: 嗯，我知道的，守密人%sirormadam%。
EN: Hmm, I know, {Male=Sir,Female=Madam} Keeper.

CN: 就连西岱这样的城市，真正读诗的人也很少很少……
EN: Even in a city like Cité, there are very few true poetry readers...

CN: 不介意？
EN: And you don't mind that?

CN: 对于柯蕾特，这是最好的纪念方式。
EN: For Colette, this is the best way to pay tribute.

CN: 至于诗本身嘛……
EN: As for the poem itself...

CN: 她从眼睛上那朵玫瑰上，摘下了一片花瓣，凑到鼻尖上。
EN: She plucked a petal from a rose above her eye and brought it to her nose.

CN: 在西岱，即使看不见花的地方，也满是花的香味。
EN: In Cité, even where flowers are not visible, their fragrance fills the air.

CN: 诗和花一样，不一定是需要被人看到的……
EN: Poetry, like flowers, doesn't always need to be seen...

CN: 她转过头来，对着你笑了笑。
EN: She turned her head and smiled at you.

CN: 守密人%sirormadam%，您相信吗？
EN: {Male=Sir,Female=Madam} Keeper, do you believe that too?

CN: 西岱仍然没有什么人读诗，但我想，玫瑰，其实早就已经开在人们心里了。
EN: Few in Cité read poetry, but I believe roses have long since bloomed in their hearts.

CN: 她扬起手。鲜红的花瓣离开她的手掌，悠扬飘远。
EN: She raised her hand. Crimson petals drifted gracefully away from her palm.

CN: 风中带着玫瑰的香味，像从数十年前的西岱吹来。
EN: The wind carries the scent of roses, as if blowing from Cité decades ago.
